item.title: A command
item.dc:creator: @Ill_Pk_You Ill Pk You
item.description:
@Ill_Pk_You wrote:

Does anybody know if this command is right?

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("3rdage")) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } else { if(playerLevel[0] >= 80){ teleportToX = 3168; teleportToY = 3245; sendMessage("You teleport to the 3rdage area."); } else { if(playerLevel[1] >= 80){ teleportToX = 3168; teleportToY = 3245; sendMessage("You teleport to the 3rdage area."); } else { if(playerLevel[2] >= 80){ teleportToX = 3168; teleportToY = 3245; sendMessage("You teleport to the 3rdage area."); } else { if(playerLevel[4] >= 80){ teleportToX = 3168; teleportToY = 3245; sendMessage("You teleport to the 3rdage area."); } else { if(playerLevel[6] >= 80){ teleportToX = 3168; teleportToY = 3245; sendMessage("You teleport to the 3rdage area."); } else { sendMessage("You need a 80 Combat stat to go in here."); } }
Also when i compile i get this error.

client.java:11846: illegal start of expression public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Anyone know why? Surrounding codes:

if (command.startsWith("pest")) { teleportToX = 2657; teleportToY = 2639; }
^ Bottom

[code] if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“Thieving”) && playerLevel[17] >= 99) {
addItem(14103, 1);
addItem(14105, 1);

}[/code]
^ Top

Read full topic
